description:
This is an introductory module in slope stability and
earth retaining structures. The topics covered
include slopes and embankments, earth pressure
and retaining structures, and basic deep
excavations. Students will learn how to check
ultimate limit states using limit equilibrium
methods and appreciate that such checks are
necessary but not sufficient (serviceability to be
discussed in advanced modules). The goal is to
teach an assessment of force and/or moment
equilibrium for slopes, calculation of active and
passive earth pressures, and appreciation of
various important design considerations pertaining
to earth retaining structures and basic deep
excavations.
title: Geotechnical Engineering
